topic.title: High-Order Resizing Overhead Support

body.p: The High Order Resizing OPUk Overhead (RCOH) defined per G.7044 is shown in Figure 1.

As noted in G.7044, these overheads belong to row 1-3 of column 15 of the OPUk overhead. These are originally part of the CnD field in the GMP process. They are converted to Resizing Overhead (RCOH) when the RP bit is activated by software.

All these overheads can be accessed via the ODTUj4 DMX stage within the device and also can be inserted via the ODTUj4 MUX stage. One stage G.HAO support will always have the ODTUj4 as the HO MUX/DMX. Two stage G.HAO support the ODTUj4 will always be on the LO MUX/DMX.
Operational Access within the ODTUj4 MUX is as follows:

li.p: Enable ODTUj4 MUX into G.HAO mode: Essentially this stops insertion of Cnd fields and inserts the RCOH from user configured registers for the active tribslot overhead (TSOH) in row 1-3 of column 15 of the OPUk Overhead.

Resize Overhead Register (RCOH) per TSOH: This contains the overhead that Software wants to insert in row 1-2 of column 15. Row 3â€™s CRC-5 and CRC-3 is automatically calculated by the Hardware and is inserted.

NORM command Trigger: Immediately before the Knife-edge, but after the [ADD, ACK] is sent via the RCOH overhead, the hardware has an automatic method to send [NORM, ACK] per TS and then automatically do LCR resize in the next Resizing Multi-frame boundary [RMF].

body.p: Operational Access within the DMX is as follows:

li.p: Enable ODTUj4 DMX into G.HAO mode: Similar to the ODTUJj MUX, this bit will stop extraction of Cnd and extract it as RCOH (into a separate register) per TSOH in row 1-3 of column 15 of the OPUk Overhead.

Resize Overhead Extraction Register (RCOH) per TSOH: This contains the extracted RCOH after a CRC check is performed. This register has an interrupt associated with it which indicates to software whenever the RCOH is changed from the last stored value.

NORM Command Trigger: Similar to the ODTUj4 MUX this register is used to put the ODTUJ4 DMX into listening to NORM mode after the [ADD, ACK] is received. Upon receiving NORM the ODTUj4 DMX will automatically do LCR resize in the next RMF boundary.

The HAO protocol requires the RP bit to be set to one at the start of the protocol. The ODTUj4 DMX detects RP=1 and interrupts software to allow software to begin the HAO protocol handshaking. The protocol terminates when RP=0. The internal state of the RP bit in the ODTUj4 DMX is not reset should the associated channel be inadvertently reset during operation of the HAO protocol. An interrupt will not be generated to detect a change in the RP state if the new state is the same as the internal state. Software can read the RP state from the internal state after taking the channel out of reset and use this value as the control for the HAO algorithm until another interrupt is received from the ODTUj4 DMX to indicate a change in the RP value. As a source or sink node, the device does not support multiple simultaneous ramps. As an intermediate node, the device does support multiple ramps.
